text.section:
Except in a county that has a local support enforcement office, the Administration is the agency that is responsible for support enforcement in all cases where a court orders an obligor to make support payments to a public agency:
as the payee; or
as collection agent for the payee.

section.section:
In this subsection, "notice of arrearage" means a written notice provided by the Administration:
to an obligor who is in arrears in making child support payments; and
relating to the arrearage.

If the Administration sends a notice of arrearage within the first 120 days that the obligor is in arrears in making child support payments, the Administration shall include notice that continued arrearage may result in revocation or denial of a license under § 10-119.3 of this subtitle.
